name: read_email
description:
Read emails from the user's mailbox.

Use either a specific message_id or search filters to retrieve one or more emails.

message_id.description: Unique ID of the email to read. If provided, other filters are ignored.

query.description: Free-text search using standard email operators (e.g., from:, subject:, before:, after:, label:). Ignored if message_id is provided.

max_results.description: Maximum number of emails to return.

include_body.description: Whether to include the full HTML/text body for each email.

returns.description:
A list of emails or a single email. Each email may include:
- message_id (str)
- thread_id (str)
- subject (str)
- from (str)
- to (list[str])
- cc (list[str])
- bcc (list[str])
- date (ISO 8601 str)
- snippet (str)
- body_html (str)
- body_text (str)
- labels (list[str])
- attachments (list of {filename, mime_type, size_bytes, attachment_id})

name: send_email
description:
Send an email from the user's mailbox.

Creates (and sends) a new message, optionally replying in an existing thread and/or attaching files.

body_text.description: Plain-text body. Provide at least one of body_text or body_html.

body_html.description: HTML body. Provide at least one of body_text or body_html.

attachments.description: Attachments to include. Each item: {filename, mime_type, content_base64} or {file_id}.

in_reply_to.description: Message ID this email replies to.

thread_id.description: Existing thread ID to continue (if known).

schedule_time.description: Optional future send time in ISO 8601 (UTC). If omitted, send immediately.

returns.description:
Information about the sent (or scheduled) message:
- status: "sent" | "scheduled"
- message_id (str)
- thread_id (str)
- scheduled_time (ISO 8601 str, present if scheduled)
- date (ISO 8601 str, present if sent immediately)

name: write_email
description:
Create or update an email draft without sending.

Use this to compose a message and save it as a draft. You can later modify or send the draft.

draft_id.description: Existing draft ID to update. If omitted, a new draft is created.

attachments.description: Attachments for the draft. Each item: {filename, mime_type, content_base64} or {file_id}.

in_reply_to.description: Message ID this draft would reply to.

returns.description:
Information about the saved draft:
- draft_id (str)
- message_id (str)
- thread_id (str)
- updated_at (ISO 8601 str)

name: PayRepayment
description:
Trigger a repayment payment and write (or update) related metadata.

Use this to initiate the repayment flow while submitting searchable/display metadata and admin fields.

entityName.description: Name of the entity (e.g., entity type "Repayment").

entityId.description: Unique identifier of the record. Max length: 64 characters.

entityGroupId.description: Grouping identifier (for admin use such as future bulk deletion). Custom-defined format. Max length: 64 characters.

description.description: User-facing description shown in the UI. Max length: 2000 characters.

logoURL.description: Thumbnail URL. Text length ≤ 512 characters; recommended size 48×48; file size ≤ 20 KB.

keywords.description: Search keywords. Array total length recommended ≤ 1000 characters.

rankingHint.description: Sorting weight for ranking. Floating-point number from 0 to 100.

expirationTime.description: Data expiration time (e.g., copyright expiry). Numeric timestamp (seconds or milliseconds—integration-defined). Max 20 characters if stored as string.

metadataModificationTime.description: Last metadata update time (for ordering). Numeric timestamp (seconds or milliseconds—integration-defined). Max 20 characters if stored as string.

isPublicData.description: Whether this is public-domain data (i.e., not user-specific).

extras.description: Additional extension fields; structure defined by the integrating business.

returns.description:
Execution result and a snapshot of saved metadata:
- status: "success" | "pending" | "failed"
- paymentId: Payment transaction ID (str)
- entityId: Echoed unique entity ID (str)
- processedAt: Processing time (ISO 8601 string)
- message: Human-readable status message (str)
- snapshot: Saved key fields snapshot (object)
